doc.previous: The last sailing true brigantine in the world is the Eye of the Wind.[9]
doc.after: The definition given above describes the international usage of the term brigantine. In modern[when?] American terminology, the term brigantine now usually means a vessel with the foremast square rigged and the mainmast fore-and-aft rigged, without any square sails. Historically, this rig used to be called a schooner brig or hermaphrodite brig.[10]
